segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 51
segments.en: Linked Discourses 51

segments.pli: 3. Ayoguḷavagga
segments.en: 3. The Iron Ball

segments.pli: 21. Maggasutta
segments.en: 21. The Path

segments.pli: Sāvatthinidānaṃ.
segments.en: At Sāvatthī.

segments.pli: “Pubbeva me, bhikkhave, sambodhā anabhisambuddhassa bodhisattasseva sato etadahosi:
segments.en: “Mendicants, before my awakening—when I was still unawakened but intent on awakening—I thought:

segments.pli: ‘ko nu kho maggo, kā paṭipadā iddhipādabhāvanāyā’ti?
segments.en: ‘What’s the path and practice for developing the bases of psychic power?’

segments.pli: Tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhave, etadahosi:
segments.en: Then it occurred to me:

segments.pli: ‘idha bhikkhu chandasamādhippadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṃ iddhipādaṃ bhāveti—
segments.en: ‘It’s when a mendicant develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm, and active effort.

segments.pli: iti me chando na ca atilīno bhavissati, na ca atippaggahito bhavissati, na ca ajjhattaṃ saṃkhitto bhavissati, na ca bahiddhā vikkhitto bhavissati.
segments.en: They think: “My enthusiasm won’t be too lax or too tense. And it’ll be neither constricted internally nor scattered externally.”

segments.pli: Pacchāpuresaññī ca viharati—
segments.en: And they meditate perceiving continuity:

segments.pli: yathā pure tathā pacchā, yathā pacchā tathā pure;
segments.en: as before, so after; as after, so before;

segments.pli: yathā adho tathā uddhaṃ, yathā uddhaṃ tathā adho;
segments.en: as below, so above; as above, so below;

segments.pli: yathā divā tathā rattiṃ, yathā rattiṃ tathā divā.
segments.en: as by day, so by night; as by night, so by day.

segments.pli: Iti vivaṭena cetasā apariyonaddhena sappabhāsaṃ cittaṃ bhāveti.
segments.en: And so, with an open and unenveloped heart, they develop a mind that’s full of radiance.

segments.pli: Vīriyasamādhi … pe …
segments.en: They develop the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to energy …

segments.pli: cittasamādhi …
segments.en: mental development …

segments.pli: vīmaṃsāsamādhippadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṃ iddhipādaṃ bhāveti—
segments.en: inquiry, and active effort.

segments.pli: iti me vīmaṃsā na ca atilīnā bhavissati, na ca atippaggahitā bhavissati, na ca ajjhattaṃ saṃkhittā bhavissati, na ca bahiddhā vikkhittā bhavissati.
segments.en: They think: “My inquiry won’t be too lax or too tense. And it’ll be neither constricted internally nor scattered externally.”

segments.pli: Pacchāpuresaññī ca viharati—
segments.en: And they meditate perceiving continuity:

segments.pli: yathā pure tathā pacchā, yathā pacchā tathā pure;
segments.en: as before, so after; as after, so before;

segments.pli: yathā adho tathā uddhaṃ, yathā uddhaṃ tathā adho;
segments.en: as below, so above; as above, so below;

segments.pli: yathā divā tathā rattiṃ yathā rattiṃ tathā divā’—
segments.en: as by day, so by night; as by night, so by day.

segments.pli: iti vivaṭena cetasā apariyonaddhena sappabhāsaṃ cittaṃ bhāveti.
segments.en: And so, with an open and unenveloped heart, they develop a mind that’s full of radiance.’

segments.pli: Evaṃ bhāvitesu kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu catūsu iddhipādesu evaṃ bahulīkatesu anekavihitaṃ iddhividhaṃ paccanubhoti—ekopi hutvā bahudhā hoti, bahudhāpi hutvā eko hoti … pe … yāva brahmalokāpi kāyena vasaṃ vatteti.
segments.en: When the four bases of psychic power have been developed and cultivated in this way, a mendicant wields the many kinds of psychic power: multiplying themselves and becoming one again … controlling the body as far as the Brahmā realm.

segments.pli: Evaṃ bhāvitesu kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu catūsu iddhipādesu evaṃ bahulīkatesu, āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharatī”ti.
segments.en: When the four bases of psychic power have been developed and cultivated in this way, they realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.”

segments.pli: Paṭhamaṃ.
(Chapi abhiññāyo vitthāretabbā.)
segments.en: (The six direct knowledges should also be expanded.)

suttaplex.blurb: Before his awakening, the Buddha reflected on the path for developing the bases of psychic power.
